target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Role.Subject: Statistics
Role.positionality: As a software developer at the bachelor's level with a focus on statistics and a keen interest in economics, my background shapes my research goals to explore quantitative methods in economic analysis. However, I recognize that my cultural and personal biases may influence my interpretation of data and findings. These biases stem from my experiences and perspectives, which can color my understanding of economic phenomena. Consequently, my positionality compels me to critically examine how my role and assumptions affect my research process, ensuring that I remain aware of potential blind spots while striving for objectivity in my analysis.

codebook.justification: The phrase [Software quality is the end result] highlights the subjective nature of quality, which varies based on user expectations and industry standards.
The term [structural perspective which is the code and the design] emphasizes the importance of design and architecture in assessing software quality, reflecting a technical viewpoint.
The phrase [meets the end user requirements] indicates that quality is not just technical but also hinges on user satisfaction, showcasing the interplay between functionality and user experience.
The concept [free of defects] suggests that quality is often measured by the absence of errors, which is inherently subjective and can vary across different contexts.
